senses.de: The main part of something that it is built on or from which something can grow.
senses.ex: She built her understanding of math on the basis of her teacher's explanations.

Tips.title: Building Blocks
Tips.description: Think of 'basis' as the foundational layer or starting blocks of a larger structure or concept.
Tips.example: The basic rules of soccer form the basis of the game.

Tips.title: Growth Platform
Tips.description: 'Basis' implies something is set up from which further development or learning can occur.
Tips.example: The principles you've learned are the basis for advancing to more complex topics.

senses.de: The main reason or cause for something to happen.
senses.ex: There is not a legal basis for the landlord to evict the tenant.

Tips.title: Cause and Effect
Tips.description: 'Basis' in legal contexts refers to a main cause or reason that explains a decision or action.
Tips.example: The jury reached a verdict on the basis of undeniable evidence.

Tips.title: Argument Grounds
Tips.description: In legal situations, the 'basis' is the solid ground on which arguments are built.
Tips.example: Her appeal had a strong legal basis and was therefore accepted.

senses.de: The system or set of methods used in a particular activity.
senses.ex: The new curriculum forms the basis for a more interactive approach to teaching.

Tips.title: Methodology
Tips.description: In certain contexts, 'basis' signifies the preferred methods or systems used to achieve results.
Tips.example: The research was conducted on the basis of a peer-reviewed methodology.

senses.de: In finance, the difference between the spot price of a deliverable commodity and the forward price of the futures contract.
senses.ex: Traders are trying to predict the future direction of the basis.

Tips.title: Price Calculation
Tips.description: In finance, 'basis' can be the calculation from which trading decisions are made.
Tips.example: They assessed the crop's value on the basis of current market trends.

Tips.title: Market Indicator
Tips.description: 'Basis' is often used to judge the profitability of a financial trade or investment.
Tips.example: Investors use the historical basis to predict future profits.

senses.de: A starting point from which something can develop.
senses.ex: These techniques will form the basis of our next discussion.

Tips.title: Conversation Starter
Tips.description: 'Basis' can be the key concept or topic that initiates a discussion or project.
Tips.example: Our conversation will have the latest study as its basis.

Tips.title: Development Foundation
Tips.description: It signifies the underlying idea or concept that inspires further development or research.
Tips.example: The work of past scientists has served as the basis for modern technological advances.

Bedrock.wordDefinition:
Bedrock refers to a firm and unshakable foundation; it is the strongest and most solid foundation upon which something can be built.

So, while both words refer to a foundation or support, basis is more general and can be used in a variety of contexts, whereas bedrock has a stronger, more foundational connotation and describes something that is essential and unmovable.

Bottom.wordDefinition:
Bottom typically refers to the lowest part of something.

It can describe physical objects, such as the bottom of a bottle, or it can refer to a metaphorical aspect such as the lowest point in someone's life, like hitting rock bottom.

Basis describes the reason or foundation for something while bottom often refers to the lowest part of something, either literally or metaphorically.

Cornerstone.wordDefinition:
Cornerstone refers to the most important part of something, upon which everything else is dependent.

It is the key or crucial part of something that holds everything else together. For example, in a building, the cornerstone is the stone placed at the junction of two walls, which provides strength and support to the entire structure.

In summary, both words are used to describe the foundation or important parts of something, but basis focuses more on the starting point, while cornerstone refers to the most important part that everything else relies on.

Foundation.wordDefinition:
Both basis and foundation refer to something that is fundamental or supports something else, but used in different contexts.

Foundation usually refers to the physical or metaphorical structure that provides support or stability. For example, "The foundation of the building was strong enough to withstand the earthquake.".

Basis refers to the underlying principle or reason, while foundation refers to the physical or metaphorical support.

Groundwork.wordDefinition:
Groundwork refers to the work that is done in preparation for something.

It is used when talking about the initial steps that need to be taken before something can be accomplished. For example, before building a house, the groundwork must be laid, which includes things like digging foundation trenches and pouring concrete slabs.

Basis focuses on the fundamental aspects of something, while groundwork focuses on the preparation and initial steps that need to be taken to accomplish something.

Premise.wordDefinition:
Premise refers to a statement or proposition that serves as the basis for an argument or theory. It's used to describe the underlying assumption or idea that a conclusion is based on.

For example, the premise of the movie is that a group of people are stranded on a desert island and must survive.

Basis refers to the foundation of something, while premise refers to the idea or assumption that forms the foundation of an argument or theory.

Root.wordDefinition:
Root, on the other hand, refers to the origin or source of something. For example, the root of a word is the part that carries the meaning, such as the word 'tele' in 'television.'.

Basis is applicable when referring to the underlying principle or foundation of something, while root is applicable when referring to the origin or source of something.

Underpinning.wordDefinition:
Underpinning refers to the support or foundation that gives strength or stability to something.

Underpinning describes the framework, structure, or foundation of something, without which it could not exist.

For instance, the underpinning of a tall building is its strong and deep foundation.

Overall, while basis refers to the essential or fundamental part of a process or structure, underpinning refers to the support or foundation that provides strength and stability.
